The Evangelists represent Jesus as begotten by the Spirit, endued with the Spirit, led and sustained in his min- istry by the Spirit. In one word, the work of the Divine Spirit is presupposed and implied in every movement for the founding and developing of the King- dom of Redemption upon earth. But God is only one of the two personal beings concerned in those spiritual transactions which we call revelation and inspira- tion. These, transactions are between persons: they involve the conception of another and finite personality regarded as set over against God. To such transactions the second party must be that kind of free and sels-conscious individuality(F1‘lrsiclz- sein) which can properly be called personality. Only such a being has capacity for revelation, or for that knowledge of God which the sels-revealing Infinite Spirit produces in the finite spirit.
